intro: Oxalis delta, commonly known as the Delta wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to South America. It features heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish or purple coloration, and it produces clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Oxalidaceae family and is characterized by its ability to thrive in well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms. Oxalis delta is also known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions once established.
